de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.slicing

Interface SliceVisitor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SliceInstructionsCollector

    public interface SliceVisitor
    A Visitor which gets informed about all nodes and their dependencies in the dynamic slice.
    Author:
    Clemens Hammacher

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void visitMatchedInstance(de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.InstructionInstance instance)
      Visit an instruction instance which directly matched the slicing criterion.
      void visitSliceDependence(de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.InstructionInstance from, de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.InstructionInstance to, Variable variable, int distance)
      Visit a dependency in the slice graph.

    • Method Detail

      • visitMatchedInstance

        void visitMatchedInstance(de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.InstructionInstance instance)
        Visit an instruction instance which directly matched the slicing criterion. These are typically root nodes in the slice graph (but they don't have to).
        Parameters:
        instance - the instruction instance which matched the slicing criterion

      • visitSliceDependence

        void visitSliceDependence(de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.InstructionInstance from,
                        de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.InstructionInstance to,
                        Variable variable,
                        int distance)
        Visit a dependency in the slice graph. from is an instruction instance which is already in the graph, and to is the instance on which from depends.
        Parameters:
        from - the origin of the dependency (the depending instance)
        to - the destination of the dependency (the instance influencing from)
        variable - null if the dependence is a control dependence, otherwise (if it is a data dependence) the variable that to writes and from reads.
        distance - the distance from the instance which matched the slicing criterion
